main event: Two objects were sighted flying in a straight line at Ft. Monmouth, New Jersey on January 6, 1953.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 12 minutes., The objects were described as moving in a straight line at level flight., No unusual speed or maneuverability was observed., An additional sighting of a silver, cigar-shaped object by an Army officer was reported around the same time., The cigar-shaped object was traveling at an estimated speed of 300-325 knots and was observed at an altitude of 15,000 feet.
witness description: Army officers present at Ft. Monmouth
